snippet: Mr. Lance, a pre-eminent adviser and tennis-playing confidant to Jimmy Carter, was forced to resign as director of the Office of Management and Budget because of accusations that he had personally traded on his ties with the president.
abstract: Bert Lance, pre-eminent adviser and tennis-playing confidant to Jimmy Carter who was forced to resign as director of the Office of Management and Budget because of accusations that he had personally traded on his ties with the president, dies at age 82.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Lance, a pre-eminent adviser and tennis-playing confidant to Jimmy Carter, was forced to resign as director of the Office of Management and Budget because of accusations that he had personally traded on his ties with the president.

headline.main: Bert Lance, Carter Adviser, Dies at 82
headline.print_headline: Bert Lance, Carter Adviser, Dies at 82; Accusations Cut Short Washington Stay
